3: Hmm, I knew it wouldn't be easy to find Mr. Big Fish.
Pulao gets off the mountain from the east. With her arms crossed and eyes closed, she mumbles to herself.
And I knew I would probably encounter some obstacles the moment I get off the mountain.
In front of Pulao are lots of road signs, and each points to a different path. On every sign is the same 'To East' text.
But this is way too much!
This is not about choosing between a 'dark, small road' or a 'bright, wide road.'
Look at this one, the entire road is green and slimy. That one is burning with sparks. None of them looks like a safe path!
Besides, this grinning man with a ponytail on the road sign looks so familiar.
O lost child, are you troubled by which path to take?
Eh? Who's there?
I am the light in darkness, the sage who casts away confusion. You may call me the Navigator or the Immortal.
Pulao looks over and sees a small, mid-aged male walking out of the forest.
That sounds pretty cool.
Not that cool. Just a little.
Um, Mr. Navigator, do you know how to go to the east? I'd like to find Mr. Big Fish.
You have come to the right person. All those titles are but fancy nicknames to describe my job. Most of the time, people prefer to call me by my profession.
The man pulls his ironed suit. A pale blue data panel appears on his chest, showing his profession: tour guide.
I present to you, a senior tour guide with twelve years of experience.
He takes a flag out of nowhere and strides forward, but pauses after a few steps and looks back at Pulao.
Don't worry, my service is free. Just give me a 5-star rating and leave a comment that is over 100 words long.
Um... Okay.
Deal. Let's delay no more and head out. Hope I can get a few more orders and good reviews today.
The stream flows quietly along the terrain and a few animals come along with the fragrance of flowers. All seems to be a quiet picture of spring, the mating season.
Ahhhhhhh!
An ear-piercing scream has disrupted the forest, sending all animals running away regardless of whatever season it is.
Don't worry, Mr. Guide, it's just a small snake. I have already released it back to the woods.
(Panting)
I have never taken this road before. Never thought it could be so dangerous.
Wow, have you never been here before?
I have to. Gotta work on my reviews.
But worry not, we are definitely on the right track. Trust the pro!
Okay...
Speaking of which, you really are brave, girl.
I have been guiding along, but without you, I would have died long ago.
It's important to help each other. You have helped me go around many traps. Without you, I would have also been in big trouble.
But you are panting a lot. Are you really okay? Shall we take another break?
I'm feeling a lot better now. Let's keep going. I still need to pick up my kid from school. We should be pretty close... I think.
Hmm...
Hmm...
Are we really going to the east, Mr. Guide?
O-of course. I've been doing this for so many years.
I see. I didn't know there were polar bears in the east.
They are not polar bears. Just some pandas using eye cream.
I see.
(Rumbling noise)
Are you hungry, girl?
Eh? No, we just ate, didn't we?
Who is it then...
Let me see.
It's okay, just the pandas following us.
What??
Relax, pandas are docile creatures most of the time.
Um... Why do they seem angry?
Rrrr—!!!
